channel.title: Well it happened, dont trust him
channel.description:
Okay so my account "TrisidiaX" got hacked on here, here are screen shots showing you how. Practically this is how this went down. i had a partnership with someone named Ali. Ali i thought was a trustworthy person, well he's not at all. I have created sources with him, and all i have seen him do is scam. he asked for my Skype account to "increase donations" (this was 2 years ago), i said okay sure, gave him my account. he changed the username, password, and every information on the account. Scammed several players and gave Trisidia the name of an scammer. well i forgave him and let him keep the account, but the longer i worked with him the more he scammed. he scammed loyal players, and anyone he could possibly get hands on to get money out of. Here is where it gets interesting. He purchased an maxed out RS account. i haven't played RS in years, so i thought he would let me play on it (for the fact i known him for 2 years and thought he was trustworthy). he wouldn't let me, unless... i gave over my account, with weeks of thinking i let him use my account again, thinking i could trust him. again he changed the information on as quick as a lighting bolt, everything was changed. Heres the screen shots:
http://prntscr.com/5559xo http://prntscr.com/555a71 http://prntscr.com/555acq http://prntscr.com/555agx http://prntscr.com/555alw http://prntscr.com/555apk http://prntscr.com/555ata http://prntscr.com/555awh http://prntscr.com/555b0l http://prntscr.com/555b4f http://prntscr.com/555bah
So no one trust him, and if a mod could please banish him or appeal my account, thanks. screen shots should prove im the rightful owner. thanks. [img]http://prntscr.com/5559xo[/img]

WHERE THE HELL DID YOU COME FROM

traditionally, my mothers uterus.
[/quote]
And, you haven’t changed at all.[/quote]

;).

item.title: Well it happened, dont trust him
item.dc:creator: @D3i7y D3i7y
item.description:
@D3i7y wrote:

[quote=“Stunninhigh, post:47, topic:547752”][quote author=D3i7y link=topic=666658.msg4458578#msg4458578 date=1416279222]
seems like a devious master of social engineering. It’s easy to earn trust with most users but i don’t understand why you would trust anyone online to be honest. I don’t trust anyone with accounts and or financial information. That’s like giving your social & credit information in my opinion online reputation is everything. If they seem to nice and or overly helpful i would suggest you keep them on a tight leash. Or just follow this guide. Keep your friends close and your enemies closer.

Some food for thought.
[/quote]

Wouldnt that be more like advice?[/quote]

Yes it would be advice. The joy of social engineering and or “E-Whoring” is profit. It can lead to simple things up to fraud and blackmail. Personally once you have dirt on someone say E-Whoring they are willing to give you money easily in fear of the fact you are posing as a child. The rest is easy so what we need is some dirt on this scammer because fear is a motivator once you have him scared he will stop until the fear is gone. anyways

Read full topic
